intro: Hermannia cuneifolia var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smoothleaf hermannia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves that are generally smooth and glossy. It produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded, moist environments.
